Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Viscous, incompressible fluid flow; flow over finite wings; aerodynamic design; introduction to computational fluid dynamics.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0), or better in all of the following EGN 3321, PHY 2049C, and MAP 2302.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Physical and engineering aspects of current space flights. Space nuclear propulsion and power. Design of spacecraft for space environment. Communication with spacecraft. Space-borne instrumentation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamental analysis and design considerations of propulsion systems. Turbojets, ramjets and rockets.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Normal and oblique shock waves, nozzles and wind tunnels, methods of analyzing compressible flow about airfoils, wings, and bodies. Viscous boundary layers and applications to the design process.

EAS4404C - Discrete Control in Aerospace.name: EAS4404C - Discrete Control in Aerospace Vehicles

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0), or better in all of the following EAS 3800C, EML 4225, and EML 4313.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Discrete control aspects of aerospace vehicles, digital controller, design, state-space representation, Z-transform, system response.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: EML 3303C or EAS 3800C or EEL 3801C or ESI 4523.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Evaluate overall impact of integration and design concepts on various satellite component subsystems and their payloads into a small satellite system design leading to a final configuration.

EAS4200 - Analysis & Design of Aerospace.name: EAS4200 - Analysis & Design of Aerospace Structures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Aerospace structures and components, loads, bending, shear and torsion of thin-walled open and closed section beams, structural idealization, analysis of fuselage and wing sections, structural instability (buckling) of columns and monocoque cylinders.
